task_prefix: Pima Indians Diabetes Database for predicting onset of diabetes mellitus. Contains diagnostic measurements from female patients of Pima Indian heritage near Phoenix, Arizona, USA. Each example contains 8 features. Predict the target class.

column_descriptions.preg: Number of times pregnant - pregnancy count for the patient.
column_descriptions.plas: Plasma glucose concentration at 2 hours in an oral glucose tolerance test (mg/dl).
column_descriptions.pres: Diastolic blood pressure (mm Hg) - minimum arterial pressure during heart relaxation.
column_descriptions.skin: Triceps skin fold thickness (mm) - measure of subcutaneous fat.
column_descriptions.insu: 2-Hour serum insulin (mu U/ml) - insulin level after glucose tolerance test.
column_descriptions.mass: Body mass index - weight in kg/(height in m)^2, indicator of body fat.
column_descriptions.pedi: Diabetes pedigree function - genetic influence score based on family history.
column_descriptions.age: Age in years - patient age at time of examination.

class_description: Classes: 'tested_negative' (Patient tested negative for diabetes according to WHO criteria), 'tested_positive' (Patient shows signs of diabetes (2-hour post-load plasma glucose >= 200 mg/dl))
